title: [REEF 180] pushing REEF.NET NuGet packages to Nuget.org automatically
body:
Added PushPackages and NuGetRepository properties to build.props. When PushPackages is set to true and Configuration is set to Release, the NuGet packages that are generated will be pushed to NuGet.Org. You can also change the repository that the packages are pushed to using the NuGetRepository property.

If pushing to NuGet.org, you must set the NuGetApiKey environment variable to be a valid API key. You must also be an owner of the REEF.NET packages on NuGet.org.

Jira REEF-180. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-180

Author: tmajest (tmajest@misrofot.com)

title: [REEF-180] Automate pushing REEF.NET NuGet packages to Nuget.org
body:
[JIRA: [REEF-180]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-180)

Added PushPackages and NuGetRepository properties to build.props. When PushPackages is set to true and Configuration is set to Release, the NuGet packages that are generated will be pushed to NuGet.Org. You can also change the repository that the packages are pushed to using the NuGetRepository property.

If pushing to NuGet.org, you must set the NuGetApiKey environment variable to be a valid API key.  You must also be an owner of the REEF.NET packages on NuGet.org.

title: [REEF-115] Pull NuGet version from lang/cs/pom.xml file.
body:
[JIRA: [REEF-115]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-115)

Pull NuGet version from lang/cs/pom.xml file.

The [Nuspec](http://docs.nuget.org/create/nuspec-reference) files for REEF projects live in each project directory.  The Nuspec files reference other REEF projects and do not yet contain version information.  Typically, you pass -Version [version] into the [NuGet pack command](http://docs.nuget.org/Consume/Command-Line-Reference#pack-command-examples) to update version information in Nuspec files.  However, this will only update the $version$ token for the package itself, not for all of dependencies in the [dependencies list](http://docs.nuget.org/create/nuspec-reference#specifying-dependencies).  This means we have to manually replace the $version$ token for each REEF project in the dependencies list in the project's nuspec file.

This fix will pull the Nuspec files into a temporary location /lang/cs/.nuget/nuspec, extract the version string from /lang/cs/pom.xml, and replace all $version$ tokens in the Nuspec files with the extracted version string.  These finalized nuspec files are then used to create the NuGet packages.

The packages are then copied to /lang/cs/.nuget/packages, but can also be found under the project's corresponding directory under /lang/cs/bin.

title: [REEF-95] Update the releases page
body:
This updates the website releases page to reflect the current
REEF release status, as well as a small change in how the release
links are displayed.

This also removes `javasvn` and instead forces the website publish user
to use `svn` client to upload local contents. This is due to a bug
related to `javasvn` that was found during the use of `publish.sh` that
prevents content being uploaded to the server.

Thanks to @johnyangk for Apache committer authentication. (not included in commit message)

Author: Julia Wang  Email: jwang98052@yahoo.com

title: [REEF-151] Fixed a synchronization issue in EvaluatorManager
body:
In EvaluatorManager, `onEvaluatorHeartbeatMessage` was `synchronized`,
  while `onEvaluatorException` was `synchronized(evaluatorDescriptor)`.
  This can create the race condition described in the JIRA. This PR is
  to change the synchronization in `onEvaluatorHeartbeatMessage` to
  match the common pattern in the rest of the file.

  Also, this makes `EvaluatorControlHandler.send()` safe to use when the
  Evaluator is already down. It used to crash in those situation. This
  change writes a WARNING to the log instead.

JIRA:
  [REEF-151](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-151)

title: [REEF-151] Fixed a synchronization issue in EvaluatorManager
body:
In EvaluatorManager, `onEvaluatorHeartbeatMessage` was `synchronized`,
  while `onEvaluatorException` was `synchronized(evaluatorDescriptor)`.
  This can create the race condition described in the JIRA. This PR is
  to change the synchronization in `onEvaluatorHeartbeatMessage` to
  match the common pattern in the rest of the file.

title: [REEF-165] Moved the protobuf version check to reef-common.
body:
This moves the version check for protobuf introduced in [REEF-160]
  from the root POM to the one of reef-common. This has two advantages:

```
1. It being in the root POM triggered execution in each submodule.
   So, moving it ever so slightly improves our build times.
2. It was inherited into the reef-bridge project, where it
   interfered with other Ant tasks there.
```

JIRA:
  [REEF-165](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-165)

/lang/cs is where the c# code goes
/lang/cpp is where the C++ code for the bridge goes

This CR is the first step that moves java code under /lang/reef/ 

It is to resolve REEF-93
https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-93

Author: Julia Wang
email: jwang98052@yahoo.com

title: [REEF-30] Run REEF on Mesos
body:
JIRA: [REEF-30]: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-30
## reef_on_mesos
#### What's in it
- reef-runtime-mesos package
- bin/runmesostests.sh (for running reef-tests on Mesos clusters)
- HelloREEFMesos in reef-examples
- MesosTestEnvironment in reef-tests
- pom.xml changes(adding reef-runtime-mesos) in root, reef-tests, reef-examples
#### How to test(reef-tests) it

Pretty similar to running reef-tests on YARN.
1. run mesos daemons (http://mesos.apache.org/gettingstarted/)
2. At $REEF_HOME, "mvn clean install -DskipTests"
3. At $REEF_HOME/reef-tests, "mvn jar:test-jar"
4. At $REEF_HOME, "bin/runmesostests.sh $YOUR_MESOS_MASTER_IP" 

Note that you may need to do additional tasks in installing Mesos depending on your platform. For example, on my Mac, I have "export MESOS_NATIVE_LIBRARY=/usr/local/lib/libmesos-0.21.0.dylib" and configured Mesos with "../configure --with-svn=/usr/local/Cellar/subversion/1.8.10_1" command. 

Google is your friend :)
#### reef-runtime-mesos package structure

Client
- MesosClientConfiguration - A ConfigurationModule for the Mesos resource manager
- MesosJobSubmissionHandler - A JobSubmissionHandler that configures and launches the driver to run on Mesos.

Driver
- MesosDriverConfiguration - Binds Driver's runtime event handlers
- MesosOfferManager - Mesos Scheduler that communicates with MesosMaster and MesosExecutor for REEF Driver
- MesosResource(Request/Release/Launch)Handler - Handles requests from REEF driver.
- MesosRuntime(Start/Stop)Handler - Handler of RuntimeStart/RuntimeStop for the MESOS Runtime.

Evaluator
- EvaluatorLaunchHandler - Handles evaluator launch requests from the driver
- EvaluatorReleaseHandler - Handles evaluator release requests from the driver
- MesosExecutor - Mesos Executor that oversees the lifecycle of a REEF Evaluator process
#### Open issues

As this package is still in development stage, many open issues remain. They will be registered as JIRA issues once this PR is merged.
- Launch REEF Driver on a slave node in the cluster
- onRuntimeStop Mesos driver stops before receiving TASK_FINISHED (confusing status on web UI)
- For NodeDescriptorProtos, Mesos Slave's ports are statically defined (5051)
- Use links, not copies in setting up Driver folder structure (there was a similar issue for reef-runtime-local)
- Create tests to cover corner cases not covered by reef-tests
- Support HA REEF Driver
- Support rack/node locality
- Support prioritized requests
- Propose making reef-runtime-local/process package public such that it can be also used for spawning Mesos Driver/Mesos Evaluator processes
- Integrate reef-tests on Mesos into CI
- Explore better ways of mapping Mesos Executor/Task to REEF Evaluator/Task
- Replace the current ad-hoc MesosRemoteManager with Tang's namespace magic
- Research on reserving unused offers instead of declining them

title: [REEF-54] Creating skeleton of driver configuration files
body:
Today SAS uses Launch/JobClient in bridge project to generate driver config file, and submit it to REEF Launcher. This requires the clients to run Java bridge Launch offline with their configuration parameters. It is easy to cause out of sync for driver configuration settings.

This PR is to generate a skeleton of  driver configuration at Java side with Java bridge JobDriver configuration settings only.  This would leave the flexibility to the client so that they can deserialize the driver configuration, and set additional parameters and then serialize the result into driver config file again.  And we have provided an API for it.

To make the configuration modularized, this PR also separated HttpServer configuration and NameServer configuration from driver configuration file when creating the skeletons. They would become building blocks. Client can choose what they want in the driver and merge them as need. This would make Http Server and Name server become optional instead of build-in in a .Net/Java hybrid driver.

The driver skeleton configuration creation has been put as part of the build and the configuration files are packed into the jar file.

There are still some static and dynamic portion of driver configurations set at Reef Runtime. We need to abstract them out and add them into the config file so that clients can call REST API directly with the complete driver config. This work is not covered in this PL.

This is to resolve issue #54. https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-54

Author: Julia Wang
email: jwang98052@yahoo.com

title: [Reef-67] Refactor utility methods in NativeInterop
body:
NativeInterop currently load CLR assemblies for the files provided in global folder, but it gets files from the jar that is not necessarily and easy to cause out of sync. This change does the following:

```
• Separate load lib in a new class LibLoader  and use injection to get the reference of the object through JobDriver constructor
• Load global files directly instead of getting them from jar
• Renamed and refactored the methods to use LoadLibFromGlobal() and loadFromReefJar()
• Put file names, folder names in ReefFileName class and use injection to get the reference in LibLoader class
• Replaced System.out into proper Log and updated logs
• Add LogScope for LibLoader
```

This is to resolve issue REEF-67 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-67?filter=-1

title: [REEF-80][HotFix] Log exceptions thrown as part of (de-)allocations
body:
This PR changes `YarnContainerManager` such that it logs exceptions thrown as part of logging container (de-)allocations instead of re-throwing them as `RuntimeException`.

This is NOT a fix for the underlying issue, but merely a less invasive failure behavior: Where current master crashes, the code with this patch doesn't support driver restarts anymore in case of failure.

Changes:
- Added the script (thanks to @dafrista, @markusweimer, @bgchun)
- Added test-jar to include test code in test-jar-with-dependencies, which we will run tests against

How to run reef-tests on YARN:
1. Build reef by running mvn clean install -DskipTests 
2. Build reef-tests jar by running mvn jar:test-jar from the reef-tests directory
3. Run the tests by running bin/runyarntests.sh

title: Jenkins test commit

Jenkins integration test pull request.

title: Creating skeleton of driver configuration files
body:
Client can submit a Job through REST API. For that, they need a serialized driver configuration file. In .Net/Java hybrid driver (see REEF-51 for a description of that), today the driver config file is created in Java JobClient, that is inconvenient for the clients.

This PR is to address this issue. It generates a skeleton of the driver configurations which only contains java configuration settings. This would leave flexibility to the client so that they can deserialize the driver configuration, and set additional parameters and then serialize the result into driver config file again.  

To make the configuration modularized, we also separate HttpServer configuration and NameServer configuration from driver configuration file when creating the skeletons. They would become building blocks. Client can choose what they want in the driver and merge them as need. This would make Http Server and Name server become optional instead of build-in in a .Net/Java hybrid driver. 

The driver skeleton configuration creation is built in pom file so that we can always get the latest config files on the fly. The config files generated are packed inside the jar file for clients to consume.

The PR added additional constructors for JobDriver (bridge) to make HttpServer and NameServer optional during the injection. 

This is for issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-54?filter=-1

title: Passing HttpServer port number over the bridge
body:
We have default value 8080 for HttpServer port number . However, when it gets conflict with others, we randomly generate one and assign it on the fly. In order for clients to get it at run time, we would need to pass it over the bridge when setting up the bridge in start handler. 

This PR is to address this issue. https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-57

title: [REEF-56]: Removed the shaded and test jar creation in reef-tests
body:
The prior addition of the `-test-jar-with-dependencies` replaces both of them. Hence, their creation has become redundant

JIRA:
   [REEF-56](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-56)

title: [REEF-55]: Delayed creation and upload of the global.jar file until the first Evaluator submission on YARN.
body:
- Added the `GlobalJarUploader` class which performs the creation and upload. It is a `Callable` such that we can move this to a thread in a future version
- Moved the actual upload logic from `EvaluatorSetupHelper` to `UploaderToJobFolder`

JIRA:

title: Introduce NameServer interface
body:
Currently there is no interface for NameServer. And all the parameters of the NameServer have default values. That means as long as clients put NameServer in driver constructor, no matter he binds it or not, it will be started. 

This PR is to introduce NameServer interface and rename original NameServer as NameServerImpl, so that if NameServer is not in a driver constructor and clients don’t bind NameServerImpl into driver configuration,  NameServer will be not started. 

Test cases are updated accordingly. 

This addresses the issue REEF-53 https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-53?filter=-1

title: Remove default class for HttpServer interface
body:
Currently the default HttpServer is HttpServerImpl that creates Jetty server and starts it. If the clients doesn’t bind any implementation, by default they will still get Jetty server running in the JobDriver. 

We would like to provide an option for clients to choose not to have HttpServer if they don’t need it for performance consideration for example. It will be covered in a separate PR. 

This PR is to remove default class from interface HttpServer. If HttpServer is not defined in Driver constructor, and if the client doesn’t bind Http configuration, then there should be no HttpServer running. 

This is to address issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-52?filter=-1

title: juwang-creating driver config files for C# clients-REEF-50
body:
Currently, for .Net clients to submit a job through REST API, they have launch Java bridge client to generate driver.config with clr arguments. It requires .NET clients to have java installed at their machine and run java program. This PR is to provide a solution for it so that C# clients only need to write C# code to generate driver.config file. 

It contains the code that generates driver.config, httpServer.config and nameServer.config at java side for bridge driver. 
It serializes class hierarchy for the configurations
It provides default implementation for HttpServer that does nothing for the case if HttpServer is not bound. 
It added interface for NameServer and provided Default NameServerImpl for the case if NameServer is not bound. 

This is to address issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-50?filter=-2

The execution of the config files generation is defined in the pom file so that it is always generated on the fly to reflect the latest changes. The config files and class hierarchy generated are packed in the jar file  after build.

title: [REEF-33]: Support pushing Task messages from Evaluator to Driver.
body:
Addresses https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-33

This PR creates HeartBeatTriggerManager that Task can inject and use to immediately send a heartbeat to Driver.

Used together with TaskMessageSource, Task can push urgent messages to Driver.

I tested it by injecting the class into HelloTask and triggering the heartbeat every 0.5 seconds. I could see the Driver receiving a heartbeat every 0.5 seconds in addition to the regular 5 second interval heartbeats.

title: [REEF-3]Create basic Task scheduler as an example
body:
The current Task scheduler example only supports one evaluator
at a time. This pull request addresses this issue to run multiple
evaluators simultaneously and introduce a new REST interface to
dynamically set the maximum number of evaluator.
- The new API : `/reef-example-scheduler/v1/max-eval?num={num}`.
- Quite a lot of code rearrange and refactoring are done.

JIRA: [REEF-3](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-3)

title: [REEF-47]: Log the REEF Version in all processes.
body:
The following changes are made to that end:
- The new method `REEFVersion.logVersion()` is added which performs the
  actual logging.
- On the client, this method is called in the constructor of
  `REEFImplementation`.
- On the Driver and Evaluator, the method is called in the constructor of
  `LaunchClass`

Also, this removes the method `REEF.getVersion()` and its implementation in
`REEFImplementation` as that method wasn't used.

Related JIRAs:
  [REEF-47](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-47)

title: Remove duplicated binding of ManagerName
body: [REEF-36](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-36). Currently RemoteConfiguration.ManagerName can be bound in either Client or Launcher, for submission path that generates a static driver.config and then submit job remotely through REST api, it will cause duplicated binding. This removes the bidding in client and add a default value to be safe.

title: [REEF-45]: Use consistent STDOUT and STDERR file names in the local runtime
body:
This updates the local runtime to use the correct file names for STDOUT and STDERR redirection as provided by the REEFFileNames class.

JIRA:
  [REEF-45] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-45

title: REEF-43: Get version number from pom (via properties file)
body:
This addresses https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-43

The injectable class `Version` now gets the version number from pom (via a properties file).

title: PR for [REEF-44]:Remove usage of artificial nCLREvaluators constrain
body: This is for [REEF-44]. Currently.net bridge java driver assumes that evaluators are only requested during startup or when evaluator fails, this is a unnecessary constrain that blocks the scenario where elastic evaluaors allocation is needed. This commit removed that man-made constrain.

title: [REEF-38] Updates according to Apache RAT output
body:
This updates the code base such that a `mvn apache-rat` passes as per [REEF-38](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-38) To achieve this, the following files have been updated with license headers:
- Tang protocol buffers schema files.
- Tang POM files

The following files and folders have been marked as exclusions from Apache RAT:
- README.\* (this also removes the now unneeded license headers from them)
- The .bin files in Tang's tests. Those are generated from the C# code base at Microsoft and are given to the ASF as a contribution.  They won't be needed anymore once we have moved the .NET code base to the ASF as well.
- REEF_LOCAL_RUNTIME and its subfolders. This directory is sometimes created during the tests. It is not actually part of a release, but excluding it and the potentially thousands of files inside speeds up Apache RAT quite a bit.
- Visual Studio project files. These are frequently overwritten, making a license header requirement quite cumbersome to support.

title: REEF-40: Replace trivial instances of Guava usage
body:
This addresses [REEF-40](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-40). In the two cases:
- Use Apache Commons
- Use Java Collections

title: Juwang http perf request REEF-29
body:
After client started job driver, clients would like to know the progress of the job execution and how much time is spent at each stage. This PR is to support such http requests. The data is obtained by parsing the scope logs.

It also allows the user to access log files through http request.

This is to resolve issue REEF-29 https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-29?filter=-1

title: REEF-38: Add Apache RAT
body:
- Added RAT
- Added license headers to poms
- Removed eclipse plugin for which no license was available
- Added a missing licensing header in the .proto files
- Added a missing licensing header in the .avsc files

*_Known issue: *_ RAT doesn't pass quite yet because somehow the exclusion of ".git" is ignored by it. We'll have to resolve that later.

title: Adressing [REEF-15]
body:
- Added a new module reef-utils.
- Moved the `Optional` class there.

title: Juwang-Inserting LoggingScopes
body:
With LoggingScope and LoggingScopeFactory, this PR is to insert LoggingScope in REEF code at major stages to measure the performance. 
This is to resolve issue REEF-28 https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-28?filter=-1

title: REEF-34: Add convencience methods for command line parsing
body: This addresses [REEF-34](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-34) and adds the two methods mentioned.

title: Adding LogScope classes
body:
To instrument reef code and measure the performance, this PR adds LogScope and LogScopeFactory classes. User can call LogScope with try-with-resources to measure the time elapsed in millis. 
LogScopeFactory supplies predefined methods, which return LogScope objects for the critical points/stages in Reef such as Driver start, Evaluator submit, etc . User can still create LogScope object directly for any piece of the code range. 
This is to resolve https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/REEF-24?filter=12329580

title: Updated LICENSE and LICENSE headers
body:
This updates the root POM to use the file `LICENSE_HEADER.txt` for the license headers. It also adds that file, taken from the Apache licensing tutorial. Also, `LICENSE.txt` is updated accordingly as well.

All other changes stem from running `mvn license:format` and are purely automatic.

This addresses [REEF-26](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-26)

title: Juwang-logscope-logparser -code instruments
body:
To instrument reef code and measure the performance, this PR adds LogScope and LogScopeFactory classes.  User can call LogScope with try-with-resources  to measure the time elapsed in millis. 

LogScopeFactory  supplies predefined methods, which return LogScope objects for the critical points/stages in Reef such as Driver start, Evaluator submit, etc .  User can still create LogScope object directly for any piece of the code range. 

This PR instruments Reef code by inserting LogScopes at major phases. A LogParser is created to parse the log data to find run time performance. 

Two http requests are supported. One is for stages the other is for duration. The result can be seen by simple http request like:
http://localhost:8080/reef/v1/duration
http://localhost:8080/reef/v1/stages

title: Extract duplicate classes in reef-examples
body:
This pull request addresses https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-19
- Currently there have been duplicate classes in some of the reef examples - ShellTask and Command.
- Further, the ShellTask in RetainedEval is outdated, even it does the exactly same thing with the one in HelloHttp.
- The classes are moved into 'o.a.r.examples.library'.
- RetainedEval and HelloHttp are tested after modification.

body: This PR addresses https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-18.
